data.title: DHMC and Clinics
data.meta_description: Dartmouth Hitchcock Medical Center and Dartmouth Hitchcock Clinics are a member of Dartmouth Health, providing healthcare services to patients across northern New England.
data.text:
6 questions about recovering from knee replacement

Surgeons Wayne Moschetti, MD, MS, and Alexander Orem, MD, MS, talk about what you need to know after getting knee replacement surgery.

Read more

Technology in Prostate Cancer Surgery Goes Further

A team of Dartmouth engineers and cancer researchers has received funding to develop surgical image guidance technology.

How Olympians Cope with Heat and Other Environmental Challenges

Athletes and doctors talk about training, competing and recovering from the Olympic Games in a changing climate.

Noteworthy

Becker’s Hospital recognizes DHMC as one of America’s great hospitals, providing care for top 5% of the sickest, most complex patients in the U.S.

DHMC receives AHA's 'Get With The Guidelines-Stroke Gold Plus Quality Achievement Award' for its commitment to ensuring the right patient treatment.

Dartmouth Health and Geisel School of Medicine team approved for $2.1m+ in PCORI funding to study patient and public involvement in research.

Elaine T. Kiriakopoulos, MD, MPH, MSc, co-authors piece on epilepsy, "Shining a Light: Advancing Health Equity in Overlooked Epilepsy Communities".

Now offering da Vinci 5, DHMC joins a select group of hospitals nationwide with a state-of-the-art surgical robot used in multiple procedures.

Dartmouth Health physician Samantha K. Swetter, MD, is named an Exemplary Psychiatrist of the Year by the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI).

Your voice matters!

What do you think the most important health needs are in our communities? We invite you to complete the 2024 Upper Valley region Community Health Needs Assessment.
